msContents.summary: A box containing stitched together ten firmāns or letters patent either granted to English merchants and to English tourists or addressed to Turkish officials and towns and two Imperial communications to Kings of England.

msItem.title: Firmān | 1 Muḥarrem 1014
msItem.note: NOTE: This record has been automatically generated with minimal modification from the corresponding entry in a printed catalogue. It may contain errors. Please, consult the References section below for more information.
Firmān, dated Constantinople, 1st of Muḥarrem, A. H. 1014=A. D. 1605, May 19.

bibl.ref: Ethé, Hermann. Catalogue of the Persian, Turkish, Hindûstânî and Pushtû Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Part II: Turkish, Hindûstânî, Pushtû and Additional Persian Manuscripts. Oxford: Clarendon Press. 1930. § (250) 2288.

Firmān, dated Constantinople, end of Ṣafer, A. H. 1028=A. D. 1619, middle of Febr.

bibl.ref: Ethé, Hermann. Catalogue of the Persian, Turkish, Hindûstânî and Pushtû Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Part II: Turkish, Hindûstânî, Pushtû and Additional Persian Manuscripts. Oxford: Clarendon Press. 1930. § (250) 2288.

bibl.ref: Ethé, Hermann. Catalogue of the Persian, Turkish, Hindûstânî and Pushtû Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Part II: Turkish, Hindûstânî, Pushtû and Additional Persian Manuscripts. Oxford: Clarendon Press. 1930. § (250) 2288.

Firmān, dated Constantinople, 9th of Muḥarrem, A. H. 1049 A. D. 1639, May 12.

bibl.ref: Ethé, Hermann. Catalogue of the Persian, Turkish, Hindûstânî and Pushtû Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Part II: Turkish, Hindûstânî, Pushtû and Additional Persian Manuscripts. Oxford: Clarendon Press. 1930. § (250) 2288.

Firmān, dated Constantinople, 1st of Muḥarrem, A. H. 1066 A. D. 1655, Oct. 31.

bibl.ref: Ethé, Hermann. Catalogue of the Persian, Turkish, Hindûstânî and Pushtû Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Part II: Turkish, Hindûstânî, Pushtû and Additional Persian Manuscripts. Oxford: Clarendon Press. 1930. § (250) 2288.

msItem.title: Firmān
msItem.note: NOTE: This record has been automatically generated with minimal modification from the corresponding entry in a printed catalogue. It may contain errors. Please, consult the References section below for more information.
Firmān, dated Constantinople, in Şevvāl, A. H. 1077 A. D. 1667, April, and presented by Rev. H. O. Daniel, March 27, 1888.

bibl.ref: Ethé, Hermann. Catalogue of the Persian, Turkish, Hindûstânî and Pushtû Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Part II: Turkish, Hindûstânî, Pushtû and Additional Persian Manuscripts. Oxford: Clarendon Press. 1930. § (250) 2288.

msItem.title: Official communication from Sulṭān Muḥammed IV
msItem.note: NOTE: This record has been automatically generated with minimal modification from the corresponding entry in a printed catalogue. It may contain errors. Please, consult the References section below for more information.
Official communication from Sulṭān Muḥammed IV (reigned A. H. 1058-1099 A. D. 1648-1688) to the King of England, France, Ireland, etc., is (Jacob, i. e. James II), defective at the end. No date.

bibl.ref: Ethé, Hermann. Catalogue of the Persian, Turkish, Hindûstânî and Pushtû Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Part II: Turkish, Hindûstânî, Pushtû and Additional Persian Manuscripts. Oxford: Clarendon Press. 1930. § (250) 2288.

msItem.title: Official communication
msItem.note: NOTE: This record has been automatically generated with minimal modification from the corresponding entry in a printed catalogue. It may contain errors. Please, consult the References section below for more information.

Official communication, dated Constantinople, 1st of Cemāẕī el-evvel, A. H. 1130=A.D. 1718, April 2, and addressed to the King of England (i. e. George I); it begins exactly like the letter mentioned in W. Pertsch, Berlin Cat., p. 481.

bibl.ref: Ethé, Hermann. Catalogue of the Persian, Turkish, Hindûstânî and Pushtû Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Part II: Turkish, Hindûstânî, Pushtû and Additional Persian Manuscripts. Oxford: Clarendon Press. 1930. § (250) 2288.

msItem.title: Firmān sent to the beglerbegi of Egypt
msItem.note: NOTE: This record has been automatically generated with minimal modification from the corresponding entry in a printed catalogue. It may contain errors. Please, consult the References section below for more information.
Firmān sent to the beglerbegi of Egypt, Sinān Paşa, not to suffer the French to meddle with the English. No date.

bibl.ref: Ethé, Hermann. Catalogue of the Persian, Turkish, Hindûstânî and Pushtû Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Part II: Turkish, Hindûstânî, Pushtû and Additional Persian Manuscripts. Oxford: Clarendon Press. 1930. § (250) 2288.

msItem.title: Firmān
msItem.note: NOTE: This record has been automatically generated with minimal modification from the corresponding entry in a printed catalogue. It may contain errors. Please, consult the References section below for more information.

Firmān, issued to the people of (i. e. Avlôna, a seaport in the Turkish vilāyet of Ioanina, Sanjak Barāt) A. H. 1102, the 20th of Ẕī l-ḥicce =A. D. 1694, Sept. 14, with a seal of Muṣṭafā bin alTāhir, dated A. H. 1187 (A. D. 1773). It belonged formerly to Dr. Thomas Hunt, Oxford.

bibl.ref: Ethé, Hermann. Catalogue of the Persian, Turkish, Hindûstânî and Pushtû Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Part II: Turkish, Hindûstânî, Pushtû and Additional Persian Manuscripts. Oxford: Clarendon Press. 1930. § (250) 2288.

msItem.title: Firmān
msItem.note: NOTE: This record has been automatically generated with minimal modification from the corresponding entry in a printed catalogue. It may contain errors. Please, consult the References section below for more information.

Firmān, entitling Mr. Edward Eliot of Exeter College, Mr. John Henry Furse of Exeter College, and Mr. Anthony William Johnson, Dean of Christ Church, to travel through Greece, dated the 1st of Cemāẕī el-evvel, A. H. 1233 A.D. 1818, March 9.

bibl.ref: Ethé, Hermann. Catalogue of the Persian, Turkish, Hindûstânî and Pushtû Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Part II: Turkish, Hindûstânî, Pushtû and Additional Persian Manuscripts. Oxford: Clarendon Press. 1930. § (250) 2288.

msItem.title: Firmān
msItem.note: NOTE: This record has been automatically generated with minimal modification from the corresponding entry in a printed catalogue. It may contain errors. Please, consult the References section below for more information.
Firmān, dated Constantinople, the Ist of Şevvāl, A.H. 1250=A. D. 1835, January 31, endorsed on the back by Hobdell Henry Fowler and Frederic Houson Potter, Queen's College, Oxford.

bibl.ref: Ethé, Hermann. Catalogue of the Persian, Turkish, Hindûstânî and Pushtû Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Part II: Turkish, Hindûstânî, Pushtû and Additional Persian Manuscripts. Oxford: Clarendon Press. 1930. § (250) 2288.

layoutDesc.layout: 1 column of varying number of lines per page

recordHist.source: Description based on Ethé, Hermann. Catalogue of the Persian, Turkish, Hindûstânî and Pushtû Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Part II: Turkish, Hindûstânî, Pushtû and Additional Persian Manuscripts. Oxford: Clarendon Press. 1930.

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card (for admissions procedures contact Bodleian Admissions). Contact specialcollections.enquiries@bodleian.ox.ac.uk for further information on the availability of this manuscript.
